p: Biological invasion has become one of the major causes of economic and environmental damage in most of the countries across the world [ 1– 3] and its impacts have been predicted to increase even further under future climatic conditions [ 4– 5]. The Convention on Biological Diversity (1992) emphasized biological invasion as one of the major driver of biodiversity decline and the second biggest threat after habitat destruction and ecosystem degradation [ 6– 9]. Climate Change, anthropogenic pressure, and land use change have accelerated bio-invasion [ 10– 11].
